source_translation: a person who finds it easy to wake up and be productive in the morning
example: I’ve never been a morning person; I usually need three cups of coffee just to function.
collocations: not much of a morning person

source_translation: to travel some distance between one's home and place of work on a regular basis
example: My daily commute takes about forty-five minutes by train.

target_translation: làm việc vặt / chạy việc ngoài
source_translation: to go out to buy or do something, such as going to the bank or grocery store
example: I have to run some errands this afternoon, including picking up my dry cleaning.

source_translation: routine tasks such as cleaning, washing, and ironing done in a home
example: We usually divide the household chores evenly between all family members.

source_translation: to go to a fitness center to exercise
example: After work, I usually hit the gym for an hour to relieve stress.

source_translation: a lifestyle with a lot of sitting and little or no physical activity
example: Office workers often have a sedentary lifestyle, which can lead to back pain.

source_translation: to work or study late into the night
example: She had to burn the midnight oil to finish the report before the deadline.

target_translation: thư giãn/nghỉ ngơi sau một ngày
source_translation: to gradually relax after a period of stress or excitement
example: I like winding down by reading a book before I go to sleep.

source_translation: the process of preparing meals or ingredients in advance to save time
example: Sunday evening is my time for meal prep for the coming week.

source_translation: a person who is socially dynamic, successful at networking, and enjoys being around people
example: My sister is a real social butterfly; she has a party to attend every weekend.

source_translation: to delay or postpone action; put off doing something
example: I tend to procrastinate when I have a difficult task to complete.

source_translation: a person who is habitually active or luminous at night
example: As a night owl, I find I am most creative after 10 PM.
collocations: be a bit of a night owl

source_translation: a period of time during which a person refrains from using electronic devices
example: I'm planning a digital detox this weekend to reconnect with nature.

source_translation: to get something to eat quickly
example: Do you want to grab a bite before the movie starts?

target_translation: ghi danh vào làm / bấm thẻ
source_translation: to register the time of arrival at work
example: I usually clock in at 8:55 AM so I can start working exactly at 9.

target_translation: cày phim (xem liên tục nhiều tập)
source_translation: to watch multiple episodes of a television program in rapid succession
example: I spent the entire Sunday binge-watching the new season of that thriller series.

source_translation: having very little money to spend
example: Living on a tight budget as a student taught me how to cook cheap meals.

source_translation: to perform job duties from one's residence instead of an office
example: Many companies now allow employees to work from home two days a week.

source_translation: polite conversation about unimportant or uncontroversial matters
example: I'm not very good at small talk with strangers at parties.

source_translation: to go to bed in order to sleep
example: It's been a long day, I think it's time for me to hit the hay.

source_translation: the activity of buying food and other household goods
example: I usually do the grocery shopping on Saturday mornings when it's less crowded.

target_translation: đa nhiệm / làm nhiều việc một lúc
source_translation: to deal with more than one task at the same time
example: I often listen to podcasts while I clean the house so I can multitask.

target_translation: thời gian chất lượng (dành cho người thân)
source_translation: time spent giving someone one's full attention to strengthen a relationship
example: The weekend is our chance to spend some quality time together as a family.

target_translation: sự lộn xộn / đồ đạc bừa bãi
source_translation: a collection of things lying about in an untidy mass
example: I need to clear the clutter off my desk before I can start working.

source_translation: a person who compulsively works excessively hard and long hours
example: He's such a workaholic that he even answers emails during dinner.

target_translation: thời gian dành cho bản thân
source_translation: time spent relaxing on one's own as opposed to working or doing things for others
example: Taking a hot bath is my favorite way to get some me-time.

source_translation: unable to move or making very slow progress because of too many vehicles on the road
example: I'm sorry I'm late; I was stuck in traffic for over an hour.

source_translation: the action of washing clothes, sheets, and towels
example: I usually do the laundry on Sundays so I have clean clothes for the work week.

source_translation: a regular series of steps taken to maintain the health and appearance of one's skin
example: My evening skincare routine includes cleansing, toning, and moisturizing.

source_translation: to prepare a clock or phone to make a sound at a specific time to wake someone up
example: Don't forget to set the alarm for 6:00 AM; we have an early flight.

target_translation: hàn huyên / tìm hiểu tin tức của ai đó
source_translation: to talk to someone you have not seen for some time and find out what they have been doing
example: I'm meeting an old friend for coffee today to catch up with her life.

source_translation: to buy prepared food from a restaurant to be eaten elsewhere
example: I'm too tired to cook tonight, so let's just order takeout.

source_translation: to give money for services like electricity, water, and internet
example: I need to go online and pay the electricity bill before it's overdue.

target_translation: giữ dáng / giữ cơ thể khỏe mạnh
source_translation: to keep oneself physically fit through exercise and healthy eating
example: She goes jogging every morning to stay in shape.

target_translation: người đi làm xa (bằng phương tiện công cộng/cá nhân hàng ngày)
source_translation: a person who travels some distance to work on a regular basis
example: The train was packed with tired commuters heading home after a long day.

source_translation: not under control
example: If you don't clean your room every week, the mess will get out of hand.

target_translation: chất lượng quan trọng hơn số lượng
source_translation: the idea that the excellence of something is more important than how much of it there is
example: When it comes to friends, I prefer quality over quantity.

source_translation: electrical machines which help in household functions such as cooking, cleaning or food preservation
example: Modern household appliances like dishwashers save us a lot of time.

target_translation: sự hòa nhập giữa công việc và cuộc sống
source_translation: an approach where work and personal life are blended together rather than strictly separated
example: Remote work has made work-life integration a reality for many people.

source_translation: to have very little left of something
example: We are running low on milk; can you pick some up on your way home?

source_translation: feeling like you have too much to deal with
example: I felt completely overwhelmed by the amount of work I had to do this week.

source_translation: a short period of sleep, typically during the day
example: A twenty-minute power nap can significantly improve your alertness.

source_translation: free from messy or unnecessary items
example: I feel much more productive when my workspace is clutter-free.

target_translation: công việc không có tương lai / triển vọng
source_translation: a job with no prospects of promotion or improvement
example: He quit his dead-end job to go back to university and study engineering.

source_translation: closely integrated and bound together by strong relationships and common interests
example: We live in a very tight-knit community where everyone knows each other.

source_translation: to make sure that the amount of money spent is not more than the amount of money earned
example: It's difficult for small businesses to balance the books during an economic crisis.

source_translation: to go out to buy or drink a coffee, often as a social activity
example: Do you want to grab a coffee tomorrow morning and catch up?

target_translation: nhấn nút báo thức lại (ngủ nướng thêm)
source_translation: to press the button on an alarm clock that stops the sound for a few minutes so you can sleep longer
example: I hit the snooze button three times this morning and ended up being late.

source_translation: food that can be prepared and served very quickly
example: I try to avoid fast food because it's usually high in salt and fat.

source_translation: the task of washing the plates, glasses, and cutlery used during a meal
example: If you cook dinner, I'll do the dishes.

source_translation: the practice of taking action to preserve or improve one's own health and well-being
example: Taking a long walk in the park is part of my weekly self-care routine.

source_translation: the times at the beginning and end of the working day when many people are traveling
example: Traffic is always a nightmare during rush hour.

target_translation: phụ huynh ở nhà chăm con
source_translation: a parent who stays at home to raise children and manage the household
example: Being a stay-at-home parent is a full-time job that requires a lot of patience.

source_translation: a check for a person's wages or salary
example: I'm waiting for my next paycheck to buy a new laptop.

source_translation: the activity of looking at the goods displayed in shop windows without intending to buy anything
example: We don't have much money, so we just went window shopping downtown.

source_translation: to prepare yourself for an activity or event, such as by dressing or packing
example: It takes me about thirty minutes to get ready for work in the morning.

source_translation: a list of tasks that need to be completed
example: I feel much more organized when I write everything down on a to-do list.

source_translation: the activity of spending time when you are not working with friends or with other people in order to enjoy yourself
example: Socializing with colleagues outside of work can help build a better team.

source_translation: to divide the cost of a meal or service equally between all the people involved
example: We usually split the bill when we eat out with friends.

source_translation: a leisurely walk, typically one taken for pleasure
example: We went for a short stroll along the beach after dinner.

target_translation: tổng vệ sinh (thường vào mùa xuân/cuối năm)
source_translation: a thorough cleaning of a house or room, typically undertaken in spring
example: It's time for some spring cleaning; we have too much junk in the attic.

source_translation: to move the garbage from inside the house to a bin outside
example: It's your turn to take out the trash tonight.
collocations: forget to take out the trash

source_translation: to remain in bed late in the morning
example: I love to sleep in on Saturday mornings because I don't have to work.

target_translation: sự chánh niệm / sự tỉnh thức
source_translation: the quality or state of being conscious or aware of something, often through meditation
example: Practicing mindfulness helps me stay calm during stressful work meetings.

source_translation: extremely tired
example: I've been working since 6 AM and I'm dead tired.

target_translation: danh sách đồ cần mua khi đi chợ
source_translation: a list of the food and household items you need to buy
example: I forgot the grocery list at home, so I can't remember what we need for dinner.

target_translation: chỉnh chải lại bản thân (rửa mặt, thay đồ...)
source_translation: to wash one's face, brush one's hair, or change clothes to feel more clean and tidy
example: Give me five minutes to freshen up after the flight before we go to dinner.

target_translation: đi chơi / dành thời gian với ai đó
source_translation: to spend a lot of time in a place or with someone socially
example: We used to hang out at the mall every Saturday when we were teenagers.

term: burning the candle at both ends
target_translation: làm việc quá sức / vắt kiệt sức lực
source_translation: to work extremely hard and be very active late at night and early in the morning
example: If you keep burning the candle at both ends, you're going to get sick.

source_translation: to catch or take a taxi for transportation
example: It's raining outside, so let's just grab a taxi instead of walking.

source_translation: a state of physical or emotional exhaustion that also involves a sense of reduced accomplishment
example: Many nurses experienced severe burnout during the global pandemic.

source_translation: to make a room or a place neat and organized by putting things where they belong
example: Can you help me tidy up the living room before the guests arrive?

source_translation: polite conversation about unimportant or uncontroversial matters
example: I'm not very good at making small talk at formal parties.

source_translation: to politely decline an offer with the implication that one may take it up at a later date
example: I'm too busy to go out tonight, but can I take a rain check?

target_translation: giá cả phải chăng / hợp túi tiền
source_translation: not costing a lot of money; inexpensive
example: We are looking for some budget-friendly travel tips for our summer vacation.

source_translation: to begin a journey or leave a place
example: We need to hit the road by 5 AM if we want to avoid the traffic.

target_translation: ngắt kết nối / nghỉ ngơi khỏi thiết bị điện tử
source_translation: to disconnect from electronic devices or the internet in order to relax
example: I try to unplug completely for at least one day every weekend.

target_translation: việc làm thêm / nghề tay trái
source_translation: a job or occupation that brings in extra money beyond one's main source of income
example: Selling handmade jewelry is her side hustle on the weekends.

target_translation: đồ uống trước khi đi ngủ
source_translation: a drink, often alcoholic, taken just before going to bed
example: Would you like to come in for a quick nightcap?

source_translation: a party to celebrate moving into a new home
example: Are you coming to our housewarming party this Saturday?

source_translation: a set of rules specifying the required manner of dress at a particular office, club, event, etc.
example: The invitation says the dress code for the gala is black tie.

source_translation: a person who gets up, arrives, or acts before the usual or expected time
example: The early bird catches the worm, so I like to start my day at 5 AM.

source_translation: to maintain communication with someone
example: Even though we live in different countries, we stay in touch through video calls.

target_translation: tên tuổi quen thuộc (mọi nhà đều biết)
source_translation: a person or thing that is well known by the public
example: The brand has become a household name over the last decade.

source_translation: not elaborate, showy, or intensive; modest or restrained
example: We had a low-key celebration at home with just a few close friends.

source_translation: the physical space immediately surrounding someone, into which encroachment can feel uncomfortable
example: Please respect my personal space and don't stand so close to me.

target_translation: đồ uống trước khi đi ngủ
source_translation: a final drink (often alcoholic) taken before going to bed at night
example: After a long dinner, they shared a small nightcap before heading home.

target_translation: hít thở không khí trong lành
source_translation: to go outside, especially after being indoors for a long time
example: I've been in the office all day; I need to step out and get some fresh air.

target_translation: quản lý việc nhà / tề gia
source_translation: the act of organizing and controlling the affairs of a household
example: Effective household management involves budgeting and scheduling chores.

source_translation: to neatly arrange the sheets and covers on a bed after waking up
example: I always make the bed as soon as I get up to start the day feeling organized.

source_translation: a very short sleep taken during the working day to restore energy
example: A 15-minute power nap at 2 PM helps me stay focused until the evening.

source_translation: to decide what you want to achieve over a particular period
example: Every Monday, I set a goal for what I want to accomplish by Friday.

target_translation: người lười biếng (chỉ ngồi xem TV)
source_translation: a person who takes little or no exercise and watches a lot of television
example: Stop being such a couch potato and go for a walk outside!
collocations: be a bit of a couch potato

target_translation: sự cân bằng giữa công việc và cuộc sống
source_translation: the division of one's time and focus between working and family or leisure activities
example: It's hard to maintain a good work-life balance when you have a demanding job.

source_translation: an informal way to say you are going to bed
example: I'm exhausted; I think it's time to hit the sack.

source_translation: how you care for your body including bathing and washing your hands
example: Maintaining good personal hygiene is the first step to staying healthy.

target_translation: chuyến đi mua thực phẩm nhanh
source_translation: a quick trip to the store to buy food or household supplies
example: I'm doing a quick grocery run; do you need anything from the store?

target_translation: đồ ăn vặt / đồ ăn không lành mạnh
source_translation: food that is unhealthy as it is high in fat, sugar, or salt
example: I'm trying to cut down on junk food to lose weight.

source_translation: to go to bed later than the usual time
example: I often stay up late on Fridays to play video games with my friends.

target_translation: đi ngắm hàng qua tủ kính
source_translation: to look at goods in shop windows without buying them
example: We spent the afternoon window-shopping at the luxury mall downtown.
